org.jcvi.jillion.experimental.align

Interface AlnWriter<R extends Residue,S extends Sequence<R>>

  • Type Parameters:
    R - the type of Residue to be written.
    S - type of Sequence to be written.
    All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AlnFileWriter

    public interface AlnWriter<R extends Residue,S extends Sequence<R>>
extends Closeable
    AlnWriter can write aln encoded alignment files like those produced by Clustal.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      void write(String id, S sequence)
      Write the given (full length) sequence in aln format.
      void writeHeader(String header) 

      • Methods inherited from interface java.io.Closeable

        close

    • Method Detail

      • write

        void write(String id,
           S sequence)
    throws IOException
        Write the given (full length) sequence in aln format. The AlnWriter will handle breaking the sequence up into groups and computing conservation etc.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the sequence; can not be null, must be unique from all the other sequences being written to the aln.
        sequence - the sequence to write. If this sequence is empty, then it is ignored. Any non-empty sequences written all must have the same (gapped) length.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem writing the sequence.
        NullPointerException - if either parameter is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if this method is called more than once with the same id.

      • writeHeader

        void writeHeader(String header)
